intro: Paepalanthus albovillosus, commonly known as the white-hairy puya, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are densely covered with white, silky hairs. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
